trample.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to step heavily on something, so that you crush it with your feet
trample.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The children were in danger of being trampled underfoot in the crowd.
Several people were nearly trampled to death in the rush to get out.
There was a small fence to stop people trampling on the flowers.
trample.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to behave in a way that shows that you do not care about someone’s rights or feelings
trample.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Their interests and rights had been trampled underfoot.
Don’t let people trample all over you.
